etymologies: early 19th century. From ancient Greek πέταλον leaf + -ite, after German Petalit

definitions: A rare lithium-containing mineral which occurs as greyish to black metallic masses with a leaflike cleavage and is used in some ceramics.

notes.text: Petalite is an aluminosilicate of lithium, LiAlSi₄O₁₀. Crystal system: monoclinic.
